column3: Might be useful for translations of idioms, songs, poetry, wordplay, political speeches, nuanced phrasings, (in stories) prophecies, riddles, rhymes, etc. Followed by members of selma'o CAI, the marker indicates the corresponding level of uncertainty in the best possible choice of translation according to the opinion/expectation/judgment of the speaker/translator. Also may indicate a cultural or linguistic gap. For Lojban especially, it might be useful when various ambiguities arise in the original text and the translator is forced to pick interpretations from among them.

column2: digit/number: the second Feigenbaum constant α = 2.502907875095892822283902873218...
digit/number: first Feigenbaum constant δ = 4.669 201 609 102 990 671 853 203 821 578(...).

Pendent preposition. Introduces a dangling argument that doesn't take part in the surrounding argument structure; similarly to {zo'u}, it may be used for pre-declaring a quantification, or for introducing an argument that will be later referred to anaphorically. The pronoun {zoi'i} is automatically bound to the argument introduced by {fai'i}.
digit/number: phi, the "golden ratio" (approx. = 1.6180...); the ratio a/b such that it equals (a+b)/a
digit/number: the fine-structure constant $\alpha \approx 7.2973525698(\dots)*10^{(-3)} \approx 1/137.035999074$.
$x_1$ squats/bends deeply at the knees while resting on their feet

attitudinal: 
{e'u } - suggestion
{e'u cu'i} - abandon suggest
{e'u nai} - warning.

attitudinal: 
{e'u } - suggestion
{e'u cu'i} - abandon suggest
{e'u nai} - warning.
$x_{1}$ is a sail for gathering propelling material $x_{2}$ on vehicle/motor $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ is an aunt/uncle of $x_{2}$ by bond/tie $x_{3}$; $x_{1}$ is an associated member of $x_{2}$'s parent's generation.
$x_{1}$ is a function/single-valued mapping from domain $x_{2}$ to range $x_{3}$ defined by expression/rule $x_{4}$.
$x_{1}$ is foreign/alien/[exotic]/unfamiliar to $x_{2}$ in property $x_{3}$ (ka).
column3: For the sense of alien (not from Earth), see {kesfange}. See also {cizra}, {jbena}, {ckini}.

column2: $x_{1}$ is an end/finish/termination of thing/process $x_{2}$; [not necessarily implying completeness].
column3: $x_1$ is final/last/at the last; $x_1$ is a terminal/terminus of $x_2$; $x_1$ is the final/terminated state of terminated process $x_2$; $x_2$ terminates/ceases/stops/halts at $x_1$ (= {selfa'o} for reordered places).  See also {krasi}, {cfari}, {mulno}, {sisti}, {denpa}, {jipno}, {kojna}, {traji}.

column2: $x_{1}$ is a factory/foundry/industrial plant/mill producing $x_{2}$ from materials $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ prevents/keeps/stops/restrains/constrains event $x_{2}$ from occurring.
$x_{1}$ translates text/utterance $x_{2}$ to language $x_{3}$ from language $x_{4}$ with translation result $x_{5}$.
column3: See also {cusku}, {bangu}. {traduki} is similar but has a different place structure.

column2: $x_{1}$ (event) annoys/irritates/bothers/distracts $x_{2}$.
column3: Also: is disruptive to.  See also {fengu}, {raktu}, {dicra}, {tunta}, {zunti}, {jicla}.

column2: $x_{1}$ opposes/balances/contends against opponent(s) $x_{2}$ (person/force ind./mass) about $x_{3}$ (abstract).
$x_{1}$ falls/drops to $x_{2}$ from $x_{3}$ in gravity well/frame of reference $x_{4}$.
column3: Note: things can fall in spin, thrust, or tide as well as gravity; (agentive "drop" = one of two lujvo: {falcru} and {falri'a}). See also {lafti}, {cpare}, {klama}, {sfubu}.

column2: $x_{1}$ is the direction of $x_{2}$ (object/event) from origin/in frame of reference $x_{3}$.
column3: $x_2$ is towards $x_1$ from $x_3$ (= {selfa'a} for reordered places).  See also {zunle}, {pritu}, {galtu}, {gapru}, {cnita}, {dizlo}, {berti}, {snanu}, {stuna}, {stici}, {purci}, {balvi}, {lidne}.

column2: $x_{1}$ develops/evolves towards/into $x_{2}$ from $x_{3}$ through stages $x_{4}$.
$x_{1}$ (event) is an event that happens/occurs/takes place; $x_{1}$ is an incident/happening/occurrence.
$x_{1}$ (du'u) is a fact/reality/truth/actuality, in the absolute.
$x_{1}$ [sequence] is in reverse order from $x_{2}$ [sequence]; $x_{1}$ (object) is inverted from $x_{2}$ (object).
$x_{1}$ is distributed/allotted/allocated/shared among $x_{2}$ with shares/portions $x_{3}$; ($x_{2}$/$x_{3}$ fa'u).
column3: Also spread, shared out, apportioned; agentive distribution (= {fairgau}, {fairzu'e}). See also {fa'u}, {fendi}, {preja}, {katna}, {tcana}.

column2: $x_{1}$ boils/evaporates at temperature $x_{2}$ and pressure $x_{3}$.
unconditional end of text; outside regular grammar; used for computer input.
non-logical connective: respectively; unmixed ordered distributed association.
{fasnu} modal, 1st place (non-causal)               in the event of ...
sumti place tag: tag 2nd sumti place.
binary mathematical operator: nth root of; inverse power [a to the 1/b power].
mark space interval distributive aspects; labels interval tense modifiers as location-oriented.
$x_1$ is a geometric ray/semi-infinite linear object with endpoint/source $x_2$ and toward and through point $x_3$ (distinct from $x_2$).
column3: Not a vector, arrow, line, or line segment. No orientation/directionality is implied.

column2: $x_1$ is an orientation of/on (base) object $x_2$ with features/characteristics/definition $x_3$; $x_2$ is an unoriented version of an object endowed with/given orientation/direction/face $x_1$.
column3: Preferred to {fardu} because of gismu similarity-conflict and the fact that {ckaji} makes more etymological sense than {dunda} does. The "giving" is nonagentive. See also: {xansa}; equivalent zi'evla version: {farnadu}.

column2: $g_1$ makes $f_1$ fall.

$k_1$=$j_1$=$c_1$=$f_1$ drift dives to destination $k_2$=$f_2$ from origin $k_3$=$f_3$ in drifting frame of reference $f_4$, via route $k_4$ using means/vehicle $k_5$ in  liquid $j_2$ beneath/under/down from $c_2$ (object/water surface) in downward frame of reference $c_3$.
$f_1$=$p_1$ is a meteor which falls to planet $p_2$ from area/planet $f_3$ with composition $p_3$
$p_1$ drops / puts by dropping $p_2$=$f_1$ onto $p_3$=$f_2$ from $f_3$ in frame of reference $f_4$
$r_1$ (event/state) is the cause of that $f_1$ falls/drops to $f_2$ from $f_3$ in gravity well/frame of reference $f_4$; under conditions $r_3$.
$k_1$ is not able to end $k_2$ (event/state) under conditions $k_3$ (event/state).
$x_1$ is the factorial of $x_2$.
$c_1$ (agent) concludes by expressing/saying $c_2$=$f_1$ for/to audience $c_3$ via expressive medium $c_4$ concluding $f_2$.
$x_1$ is a place where $x_2$ (event) ends
$c_1$ is a terminator of class/part-of-speech $c_2$ in language $c_3$.
$b_1$ is canvas of material $b_2$.
function $f_1$ is discontinuous/abrupt/sharply changes locally (in output) on/at $s_2$ (set), with abruptness of type $x_3$ (default: 1)
column3: $s_2$ should be a set within some open subset of definition of $f_1$, or a set on which $f_1$ is not defined at all. For $x_3$, an argument of $n$ (number) corresponds to a differentiability class of order $n$, to which $f_1$ does NOT belong at points in set $s_2$; notice that such an $n$ makes no implications about the truth value of $f_1$ belonging to any given differentiability classes of order $m<n$, but $f_1$ cannot belong to differentiability classes of order $m>n$;  $n$=$0$ implies that the function is not continuous on that set (lack of definition there is sufficient for such a claim); a function that is discontinuous or which has a cusp or sharp 'corner' in its graph/plot (meaning that its derivative is discontinuous) at points in $s_2$ will have $n≤1$. For now at least, $n$ can be a non-negative integer; generalizations may eventually be defined. This lujvo is not perfectly algorithmic/predictable.

column2: $p_1$ is a graph of function $p_2$=$f_1$ drawn by $p_3$ in medium $p_4$
$x_1$ is a quantity of/contains/is made of xenon (Xe).
$p_1$=$f_2$ feels hospitality/foreign love towards $p_2$=$f_1$.
$t_1$=$d_1$=$f_1$ is a windsurfingboard of material/property $t_2$.
column3: From {tanbo}, {djacu}, {falnu} (f2, f3 subsumed). See also sufingboard (={bonjacta'o}), kitesurfingboard (={volfanjacta'o}), wakesurfingboard (={blobonjacta'o}).

column2: $k_1$ sails to destination $k_2$ from origin $k_3$ via route $k_4$ on sailing vehicle $k_5$=$f_3$.
$g_1$ is a/the manufacturing industry/sector, manufacturing/processing $g_2$=$f_2$ at factories/plants $f_1$ from materials $f_3$ using process $g_3$
$p_1$ is an industrial park managed by community/polity/company $p_2$ for factories/plants producing $f_2$.
$x_1$ is an obstruent (phonetic) sound
column3: Contains all consonants ({zunsna}) that are not sonorants ({ra'isna}). Includes fricatives ({mosysna}) and plosives ({ga'osna})

column2: $c_1$ is a translation of version that $c_2$=$f_2$(original/sourcetext) is translated by $c_3$=$f_1$(translator) from $f_3$(original language) into $f_4$(translation language)
$c_1$ gets lost on the way to $f_2$ (object/event) in/near $f_3$=$c_3$
$x_1$=$d_1$ is the opposite direction from $x_3$=$f_3$ that $x_2$=$f_2$ is.
$g_1$=$f_3$ aims at $f_1$ with $f_2$ (object/event).
column3: $x_3$ can be $x_1$ itself or an extra object/event such as "weapon", "effort", etc. Cf. {farna}.

column2: $j_1$ shows the direction of $f_2$ (object/event) to audience $j_3$, that direction being $f_1$
column3: $f_3$ defaults to the $x_1$, in other words the direction (i.e. $x_4$) is relative to the $x_1$ place.  Cf. {farsni}, {degja'o}.

column2: $x_1$ moves towards $x_2$ from direction $x_3$
$s_1$=$f_3$ non-agentively/inanimately points at/indicates the direction of $s_2$=$f_2$ to observer $s_3$ as being in the direction $f_1$.
column3: $f_3$ defaults to the $x_1$, in other words the direction (i.e. $x_4$) is relative to the $x_1$ place.  Cf. {farja'o}, {degja'o}.

column2: $x1$ is a compass
$x_1$ treats $x_2$ in way $x_3$ (ka)
$s_1$=$f_1$ reflects Breton culture/language in aspect $s_2$=$f_2$.
$v_1$ is a verb meaning $v_2$ in language $v_3$.
$f_1$=$b_1$ is the French language used by $b_2$ to express/communicate $b_3$ (si'o/du'u, not quote).
$x_1$ is the English Channel/La Manche
column3: It might include the body that forms or partially forms the water-border of Belgium or the Netherlands.

column2: $g_1$=$f_1$ is the country of France.
$x_1$ is a quantity of/contains/is made of gallium (Ga).
$r_1$=$f_1$ is a Gallic/French Rose/Rose of Provins (Rosa gallica) of species/strain $r_2$.
$x_1$ (object) regresses/declines/anti-develops towards/into $x_2$ (state) from $x_3$ (state) for reason/because of $x_4$ (fact, event) through stages $x_5$
$f_1 = k_1$ [sequence] is able to be / capable of being reversed from / into sequence $f_2$ by event $k_2$ under conditions $k_3$ (event / state).
$x_1$=$fc_1$ is an inverse function from domain $x_2$=$fc_2$ to range $x_3$=$fc_3$ defined by original function $x_4$=$f_4$
$s_1$ implodes into pieces/energy/fragments $s_2$.
$x_1$ (me'o) is the p-adic representation of number $x_2$ in base $x_3$.
column3: can be infinitely long to the left but not the right; for repeating p-adics ({krefu} fatysaclu) use {ra'e} before {pi}

column2: $x_1$ (event) varies in intensity/amount
$x_1$ (event) happens mildly/non-extremely/gently/somewhat
$x_1$ (event) seems to happen/take place to observer $x_2$
$x_1$ (nu) is a sufficient condition/is enough for $x_2$ (nu) to happen
the amount/intensity of event/state $x_1$ is too high for $x_2$ to happen; $x_1$ happens too much for $x_2$ to happen
$x_1$ (event) decreases in intensity/amount
$x_1$ can happen but has not happened yet (unrealized potential)
$f_1$=$s_1$ (event) happens swiftly/quickly/rapidly
$f_1$ is an event that has time/temporal duration $t_1$ ranging from starting time/event $t_2$ to ending time/event $t_3$.
$x_1$ (event) is continuing beyond its expected duration/endpoint.
$x_1$ (event) increases in intensity/amount
$f_1$=$s_1$ (event) happens slowly
$x_1$ (event) is constant in intensity/amount
$x_1$ (event) happens intensely/in a great degree
$g_1$ develops $f_1$ into $f_2$ from $f_3$ through stages $f_4$.
$f_1$=$m_1$ is homologous to $f_1$=$m_2$ in property/aspect $m_3$
$m_1$ is an example/instance of developmental/evolutionary stage/state $m_2$=$t_1$ of developing thing $t_2$=$f_1$ in its development towards/into $f_2$ from $f_3$ through stages $f_4$=$m_3$.
column3: Someone causing the development is neither implied nor denied;  hence this word can be used both for Darwinian evolution and software development.  Made from {favytcini} + {mupli}.

column2: $p_1$=$f_2$ begs $p_2$=$f_1$ for forgiveness for action $f_3$.
$x_1$ apologizes to $x_2$ / asks $x_2$ for forgiveness for action $x_3$ (property of $x_1$)
$g_1$ [person/agent] annoys, by doing $f_1$ [event], $f_2$ [person].
column3: The annoyance must not neccessarily be intentional. Cf. {fanza} (for an annoying event), {gasnu}.

column2: $t_1$ chatters/gossips to $t_2$=$f_2$ about subject $t_3$ in language $t_4$.
$g_1$ (person/agent) boils $x_2$=$f_1$ at temperature $x_3$=$f_2$ and pressure $x_4$=$f_3$.
column3: Note that this means simply to evaporate a liquid; to cook something by boiling is {febjukpa}.  Also c.f. {jukpa}, {djacu}, {ladru}, {cidja}, {patxu}.

column2: $x_1$=$ju_1$ simmers/cooks/prepares food-for-eating $x_2$=$j_2$ by sitting it in simmering liquid $x_3$=$ji_1$=$f_1$ at temperature $x_4$=$f_2$ and pressure $x_5$=$f_3$.
column3: See also: boil (={febjukpa}), poach (={febmlijukpa}), blanche (={juprblanca}), court bouillon (={likrkorbojo}/{febmliseljukpa}).

column2: $x_1$=$j_1$ cooks/prepares food-for-eating $x_2$=$j_2$ by sitting it in boiling liquid $x_3$=$f_1$ at temperature $x_4$=$f_2$ and pressure $x_5$=$f_3$
$x_1$=$ju_1$ is poaching/cooks/prepares food-for-eating $x_2$=$j_2$ by sitting it in poaching liquid/court bouillon $x_3$=$m_1$=$f_1$ at temperature $x_4$=$f_2$ and pressure $x_5$=$f_3$.
$x_1$ is a falcon (genus 'falco').
$x_1$ is measured as $x_2$ (number) on the Fahrenheit scale

$x_1$ is the Fourier transform of function $x_2$ where its $x_3$th argument (time-domain variable) is transformed into the corresponding frequency-domain variable $x_4$ (in the same position in the Fourier transformed function argument list) using conventions (especially mention normalization factors) $x_5$
$x_1$ is the result of applying mathematical function/operator $x_2$ to the terms of ordered list $x_3$ (inputs) in the order presented, according to system/definition $x_4$
$x_1$ (person/computer/agent) finds the result of applying mathematical function/operator $x_2$ to arguments $x_3$ (ordered list)
column3: Useful for commanding some one to "add these numbers together", "find the sum of...", "take the conjugate of...", etc. In some sense, is equivalent to "calculate" or "compute" in reference to an operator being evaluated on an ordered list or inputs.

column2: what satisfies property $x_1$ conditions what satisfies property $x_2$; what satisfies $x_2$ depends on what satisfies $x_1$
$x_1$ is a fixed point of function $x_2$
the amount/intensity of event/state $x_1$ is too high for $x_2$ to happen; $x_1$ happens too much for $x_2$ to happen
$x_1$ (entity) is fantastical, exhibiting $x_2$ (property of $x_1$), which is relevant to magic, myths or fictive medieval technology and thus extraordinary
$x_1$ is a medicine (object) used to treat illness $x_2$
$x_1$ (event) is ongoing when $x_2$ happens
$x_1$ is an orientation of/on (base) object $x_2$ with features/characteristics/definition $x_3$; $x_2$ is an unoriented version of an object endowed with/given orientation/direction/face $x_1$.
column3: The "giving" is nonagentive. See also: {xansa}; equivalent gismu version: {farka}.

column2: $x1$ is the direction of vector $x2$ in Hilbert space (with basis/in coordinates, including defined scales and origins) x3; $x1$ is the direction of $x2$ in a Hilbert sense
column3: For example: quantum spin vectors are in terms of Hilbert space directions (components are oriented along directionals that are oriented in a Hilbert sense, rather than a physical/spatial sense). Such directions are a subset of the set of all directions. See also: {farna}

column2: $x_1$ is a voiceless bilabial fricative sound produced by $x_2$.
column3: Derived from and synonymous with {fy zei sance}. The odd morphological form serves to place the most salient consonant in the stressed syllable.
column6: F sound;voiceless bilabial fricative;voiceless bilabial fricative sound

column2: $x_1$ is fascist/nationalist ideology of $x_2$; $x_2$ is a fascist
$x_1$ is a warthog (Phacochoerus africanus) of type $x_2$
$x_1$ is a part of Lojban text representing rule 'rp-expression' according to the first edition of the book 'The Complete Lojban Language'.
column3: Inner structure of the rule: rp-operand rp-operand operator. For the description of the syntax see {jarnezi}.

column2: $x_1$ is a part of Lojban text representing rule 'rp-operand' according to the first edition of the book 'The Complete Lojban Language'.
column3: Inner structure of the rule: operand | rp-expression. For the description of the syntax see {jarnezi}.

column2: $x_1$ is the result of evaluating formal expression $x_2$ (quote; extracts the contents therefrom in order) according to rules $x_3$
column6: result of evaluation of formal expression

column2: $x_1$ happens, then if $x_2$ is true, $x_1$ repeatedly happens as long as $x_2$ is true
$x_1$ is a mathematical object for/to which operator $x_2$ is defined/may be applied when under conditions $x_3$ under definition (of operator)/standard/type $x_4$
column3: The result is unimportant. Mathematical objects cannot really do anything nor can they experience anything, and they are not altered, so "{kakne}" does not really work. $x_2$ may be a "{mau'au}"-"{zai'ai}"-quoted operator (possibly with some of its terbri filled). $x_3$ determines when (example: for which points $z$ in the domain set) $(x_2 (x_1))(z)$ makes sense/is defined. $x_4$ can be a macro which really is a name of a type of such operator ($x_2$ represents the class, $x_4$ denotes the specific realization), the name being associated with all of the conditions/rules/descriptions necessary. "Differintegrable (according to some definition or type of differintegral operator named $x_4$)": ~"faukne be lo {salri} co'e" (where $x_3$ will be the set upon which  $x_1$ is differintegrable and $x_4$ can be words like "partial", "directional", "vectorial", "total", "Riemann", "Lebesgue", vel sim.).

column2: $x_1$ is the result of evaluating mathematical object $x_2$ at point/with input value $x_3$ (ordered tuple)
column3: Currently, partial evaluation is not supported. $x_2$ should be a mathematical function which has/is defined with indeterminates (such as a polynomial (in the abstract algebraic sense: a finite and ordered tuple of coefficients from an algebraic ring)) or a function. $x_1$ is a concrete, explicit, and specific object with a single value; although this might be called a number, it need not be a scalar; it could be a scalar, a vector, a point, a more general tensor, or many other things. It itself could even be function, if we understand $x_2$ to be a function-valued map with its domain being an index telling which function it is (such as is the case, sort of, with homologies).

column2: $x_1$ (function) is the restriction of function $x_2$ to domain set $x_3$
column3: $x_3$ should normally be a (strict) subset of the domain set of $x_1$; however, for generality, any set is allowed, but $x_1$ will be undefined everywhere except on/in the intersection of $x_3$ with the domain set of $x_2$. Outside of $x_3$, $x_1$ is undefined, even if $x_2$ is. In/on $x_3$, $x_1$ and $x_2$ are identically equal everywhere. $x_2$ is a specific extension of $x_1$. For the sense of restriction in which, instead of being undefined outside of $x_3$, $x_1$ is identically equal to the zero element of the space on the set exclusion of the domain of $x_2$ lacking $x_3$ (and which is undefined everywhere not in the domain set of $x_2$), try to use a product of a {zdeltakronekre} function with $x_2$, which will be defined on the intersection of their two domain sets and will identically be 0 or $x_2$ as specified. Be careful, concerning $x_3$, when the domain set of $x_2$ is the Cartesian product ({pi'u}) of sets; for example, $R$ is not a subset of $R^2$, even if it is isomorphic to one (actually, uncountably infinitely many in this case).

column2: $x_1$ (nu) happens together with $x_2$ (nu); $x_1$ happens while $x_2$ (one sense)
column3: One proposed definition of {fau} {ko'a} is {xoi} {ko'a} {faunli} {ke'a}, i.e. {fau} is redefined to be the BAI of {faunli}. See {fasnu}.

column2: $x_1$ is happening although it was expected to begin later
sentence fence: the speaker is done speaking and signals to the addressee that they may now speak up if they so desire.
column3: The speaker may change their mind and add a new sentence after this cmavo has been uttered. In the meantime the addressee is free to speak in their turn.

column2: end of all Lojban text, forever.
column3: Once this word is said, no more Lojban text will ever be parsed, in any form. See also {su'u'u'u'u'u'u'u}.

column2: Convert operator to being entrywise.
column3: Applied to an operator by immediately following it; breaks the symmetry which that operator may have had: the first argument of the operator is to be a tensor or (multidimensional) list, or a set, or something with many internal terms, entries, elements, components, etc; the subsequent arguments of the operator are arbitrary. The result is to apply the operator with the subsequent arguments to each term, entry, elements, etc. of the first argument individually. For example, for matrix A=((1, 2), (3, 4)), A+(fau'a)10 = ((11, 12),(13, 14)) and A^2 = ((7, 10), (15, 22)); however, A^(fau'a)2 = ((1, 4), (9, 16)); likewise, sin(A) = A - (1/3)A^3 + (1/5)A^5 - ..., but sin(fau'a)(A) = ((sin(1), sin(2)), (sin(3), sin(4))), which is meant to show the distribution of the sin() function to each entry of A, although it also happens to be equivalent to applying the Taylor expansion to A via "fau'a" as well. Caution must be used: matrix addition or scalar multiplication of matrices already have this distributional property, so this word is not needed in those cases; in fact, A+(fau'a)A would yield ((1+A, 2+A), (3+A, 4+A)), which is nonsensical (because, without "fau'a", the addition of a scalar entry to a matrix is undefined).
column6: distribution of function to entries;entrywise function application

column2: non-logical connective: antirespectively; unmixed but reverse ordered distributed association.
column3: Works together with {fa'u}; given an ordering by {fa'u}, the terms connected by this word are (applied) in opposite order.

column2: Iteratively applies "fau'a" to each resultant operator until all operators resolve.
column3: Let matrix A = ((1, 2), (3, 4)); then A +(fau'ai) A = A +({fau'a}*) A = ((1 +(fau'a*) A, 2 +(fau'a*) A), (3 +(fau'a*) A, 4 +(fau'a*) A)) = (( ((1+1, 1+2), (1+3, 1+4)), ((2+1, 2+2),(2+3, 2+4)) ), ( ((3+1, 3+2), (3+3, 3+4)), ((4+1, 4+2), (4+3, 4+4)) )), which has all of the additions resolve (so the iteration terminates) - the result is a 2-by-2 matrix in which each entry is itself a 2-by-2 matrix. If the operators resolve after differing iteration counts, then the process continues only on the unresolved ones with the resolved ones being held constant and saved.

column2: two-tier function map/assignment writer notation: X1 (ordered list, no repetitious terms) maps termwise-respectively to X2 (ordered list; may be repetitious but must have exactly as many terms as X1)
column3: So named because, in mathematical notation, the domain set of the function is written down in some order in its entirety and then, below it, the range of the function is written so that each image and preimage line up vertically with their appropriate/respective partner. Really useful when mapping from a countable set/object that is either human-small or in which the pattern is clear. Occasionally used for a more explicit form of notation for permutations (in which cycle decomposition is not necessarily as evident, but the structure as a how is, at least, explicit). The ith term of X1 is mapped to the ith term of X2; there is no knowledge of what happens to any value that is not term of list X1.  Useful for lambda calculus.
column6: assignment writer notation;function map writer notation

column2: iterated function left-composition with self: f∘f∘...∘f, n times.
column3: First argument must be a function(al) or some object f that can be left-composed with itself (and which is unary); second argument is a real number (usually nonnegative integer) n for which n compositions of f makes sense; the result is f left-composed with itself n times and, as such, is itself a function(al) or other object of the same sort as f (therefore, it can then be applied to an m-tuple input, where m is less than or equal to the arity of f; if f is a function, then the output will generally not be a number in the codomain of f, but rather a function itself). This word is a shortcut for longer expressions. See also: {fa'ai}, {se'au}, {te'a}, {fe'a}.

column2: mekso ternary operator: inverse function of input function $X_1$ with respect to its input $X_2$, taken on branch or restricted domain $X_3$ ("domain" being of $X_1$).
column3: The output of this function is itself a function of the same arity as $X_1$. $X_3$ often omitted due to obviousness (or due to lack of need/due to well-definition) or convention. $X_1$ should be a function supplied in "{zau'au}" quotes; that function itself should be at least unary and the input against which the inverse is being taken in an n-ary $X_1$ is $X_2$. $X_2$ should technically be a input slot index or domain (or subspace/projection thereof), but a named and non-evaluated dummy variable symbol can be supplied if the slot ordering or domain terms (vel sim.) are not well-specified. Because the output is a function, it can itself (that is: the output's self) have an input; use "{bai'i'i}" or an equivalent thereof for this purpose in most situations. For example, if $f(x,y,z)=w,g=fau'i(f,2),v=(x,y,z)$, and $u=bai'i'i(v,2,w)=(x,w,z)$, then $g(u)=f^{-1}_2(x,w,z)=y$. In English notation, "$fau'i(f,n)$" might be notated as "$inv(f,n)$". See also: "{fau'e}" (this word acts as a better-specified case of iteration order $n=-1$ for "fau'e").

column2: any way, under any events
Forgive me!/I'm sorry!
mekso ternary operator: positive super-root; the $b$th super-root (inverse operator of hyper-operator with respect to base) of $a$ of order $c-2$.
column3: c must be nonnegative (and currently must also be an integer). c=3 yields the basic/typical bth root function on $a$ (undoes exponentiation); c=4 yields the bth sroot (undoes tetration). In conventional English notation (not necessarily Lojbanic), this is the right-inverse on the same-order hyperoperator. See: {dei'au'o}, {te'au'u}, {de'au'u}

column2: location event contour tense: perfective in space; beyond the place of ...
location event contour tense: continuative in space; throughout the place of ...
location event contour tense: initiative in space; on this edge of ...
location event contour tense: achievative in space; at the point of ...
$x_{1}$ sews/stitches/sutures materials $x_{2}$ (ind./set) together with tool(s) $x_{3}$, using filament $x_{4}$.
column3: ($x_2$ if a set must be a complete specification); See also {cilta}, {jivbu}, {jorne}, {nivji}, {pijne}, {lasna}.

column2: $x_{1}$ is measured in kopeck/cent money-subunits as $x_{2}$ [quantity], in monetary system $x_{3}$.
column3: Also pfennig, paisa, sen, fen, dinar, etc.; $x_1$ is generally a price/cost/value.  (additional secondary, tertiary, etc. subunit places may be added as $x_4$, $x_5$, $x_6$, ...); See also {sicni}, {jdini}, {jdima}, {vecnu}, {rupnu}, {dekpu}, {gutci}, {minli}, {merli}, {bunda}, {kramu}.

column2: $x_{1}$(s) is/are waste product(s) [left to waste] by $x_{2}$ (event/activity).
column3: Also shit, crap; agentive wasting (= {fesygau}, {fesyzu'e}).  See also {xaksu}, {kalci}, {pinca}.

column2: $x_1$ is a female/doe of species $x_2$ evidencing feminine physical/biological/genetic trait(s) $x_3$ (ka); $x_1$ is feminine.
column3: See also {nakni}. For culturally female traits, see {jikyfetsi}.

column2: $x_{1}$ is a fig [fruit/tree] of species/strain $x_{2}$.
digit/number: hex digit B (decimal 11) [eleven].
elidable terminator: end nonce conversion of selbri to modal; usually elidable.
sumti place tag: tag 3rd sumti place.
sumti place tag: place structure number/tag question.
{finti} modal, 1st place (creator)                  created by ...
vocative: \n{fi'i} - hospitality; you are welcome/ make yourself at home.\n{fi'inai} - inhospitality
$x_1$ is a fiber of type/material $x_2$
$x_1$ pretends/feigns that $x_2$ is true in activity $x_3$; $x_1$ does $x_3$ as though $x_2$ were true
$f_1$=$c_1$ is without anger/mild/meek regarding $f_2$ for $f_3$ (action/state/property).
$s_2$=$f_2$ is in trouble with $f_1$ over $f_3$, causing problems $s_3$
$x_1$ recycles $x_2$ for new purpose $x_3$.
$c_1$ is intended to be disposed of after use; $c_1$ is disposable.
column6: designed to be thrown away;disposable;intended to be thrown away;throwaway

column2: $t_1$ is a disposable tool/utensil/resource used for doing $t_2$; $t_1$ is intended to be thrown away after doing $t_2$.
$t_1$ is an incinerator for burning waste $t_2$=$f_1$.
$b_1$ is a trash bin/trash can/recycle bin with contents $b_2$=$f_1$, made of material $b_3$.
column6: dustbin;garbage bin;garbage pail;recycle bin;refuse bin;refuse can;rubbish bin;trash bin;trash can;waste bin

column2: $d_1$ is a refuse bag with refuse $d_2$=$f_1$, and of material $d_3$.
column3: Any bag with trash inside counts as trash bag in this context.
column6: bin bag;bin liner;dustbin liner;garbage bag;refuse bag;refuse sack;rubbish bag;trash bag

column2: $x_1$=$g_1$ [person/agent] leaves waste product/wastes $x_2$=$f_1$ by event/activity $x_3$=$f_2$=$g_2$
$x_1$ removes waste/trash $x_2$ from $x_3$.
column6: clean;perform waste removal;remove trash;remove waste;separate waste;take out;take out waste;throw away;throw out

column2: $s_1$ is garbology based on methology $s_3$.
$x_1$ is a landfill or other area where refuses/garbages are disposed of.
$c_1$ is a goddess (female deity) of people(s)/religion $c_2$ with dominion over $c_3$ [sphere].
column3: Cf. {nakcei}, {fetsi}, {cevni}, {lijda}, {krici}, {censa}, {malsi}. Recommended to be used only use when contrasted with {nakcei} or femininity of the deity is to be emphasized/important.

column2: $c_1$ is gynophilous [sexually attracted to women] in situation $c_2$ by standard $c_4$.
column3: This word is only about sexual interest in females; other sexual interests are irrelevant. Cf. {nakcinse}, {fetfetcinse}, {mitcinse}, {dutcinse}.

column2: $fa_1$=$fe_1$ is an aunt of $fa_2$ by bond/tie $fa_3$.
$c_1$=$f_1$ is female and gynophilous/gay/bisexual in situation $c_2$ by standard $c_4$
column3: This word is about female homosexuality and bisexuality. See also {fetcinse}, {naknakcinse}, {mitcinse}, {relcinse}.

column2: $f_1$=$n_1$ is an unmarried woman under law/custom/tradition $s_3$.
$x_1$=$t_1$ is panties/knickers/boy shorts (female genital underwear), serving purpose $x_2$=$t_3$
column3: Female genitalia/crotch/vulva-covering type of underwear. Needn't be worn by female/woman/girl but garment need be made for female genitalia/pubic region in some manner (see {nakpibyta'u}/{pibyta'u} for male/non-defined counterpart). Cf. {nerta'u}, {taxfrbikini}, {tatyta'u}.

column2: $x_1$ is a gamete of female $x_2$.
$x_1$ is a wife of $x_2$ (spouse) according to marriage tradition/custom/law $x_3$.
$t_1$ is a matriarch of people/territory/domain/subjects $t_2$.
$x_1$ is an ovary of $x_2$.
$x1$ is/demonstrates/exhibits sexual orientation toward females in situation $x2$ by standard $x3$
column3: In a gender binary, this word covers half of each heterosexuality and homosexuality. It is not strict (in other words, bisexuals are both male- and female-attracted). Could be useful for transexuals with a definite preference, as well. See also: {naktricinse}

column2: $c_1$=$f_1$ growls/snarls/roars c2 [non-linguistic utterance] in anger at $f_2$ for $f_3$ (action/state/property).
$x_1$=$j_1$ is the cellulose of fibre $x_2$=$j_2$=$f_1$
$x_2$ (property) is satisfied by a number different from that expected by $x_1$ with likelihood $x_3$

$x_1$=$p_1$ thinks that $x_2$=$f_1$ differs from/is distinct from/contrasts with/is unlike $x_3$=$f_2$ in property/dimension/quality $x_4$=$f_3$; $x_1$ distinguishes between $x_2$ and $x_3$ because of differing property/dimension/quality $x_4$.
column3: Use {su'ai} for distinguishing among more than two things.

column2: $b_1$ becomes different/changes/transforms from $f_2$ in property/dimension/quantity $f_3$ under conditions $b_3$.
$s_1$ (set) differs/are distinct from/contrasts with/are unlike each other in property/dimension/quantity $f_3$.
$x_1$ is an injective function (distinctness-preserving function) from $x_2$ (domain) to $x_3$ (codomain).
column3: This is a {brapagjvo} (one of its veljvo is the zi'evla "{stodraunju}"). Let $f$ be the sumti which fills $x_1$; for any $y$ and $z$ in $x_2$, $y$ =/= $z$ iff $f(y)$ =/= $f(z)$.

column2: $c_1$ is a fish-eater of fish species $f_2$.
$x_1$ is a fiesta
$cu_1$=$cf_1$ is a fictional book about plot/theme/subject $cf_1$ by author $cu_3$=$cf_3$ for audience $cu_4$ preserved in medium $cu_5$.
$x_1$ pertains to Easy French language in aspect $x_2$
$g_1$ [person/agent] causes $f_1$ to be easy for $f_2$ under condition(s) $f_3$.
$z_1$=$f_1$ (action) is easier than $z_2$ (action) for $x_3$=$f_2$ (agent) by amount $z_4$ under conditions $x_5$=$f_3$.
$x_1$ is the easiest among $x_2$
$r_1$ [event/state] causes $f_1$ to be easy for $f_2$ under condition(s) $f_3$.
$s_1$=$f_1$ is simple/easy in property $s_2$ for $f_2$ under conditions $f_3$
$g_2$=$f_1$ is apparent to $g_1$ via perceptual/cognitive faculty $g_3$.
column3: x3 includes reason or critical thinking skills as well as discrete biological organs such as eyes or ears. Cf. {frili}, {sapselga'e}, {sampu}, {klina}.

column2: $f_{1}=sj_{1}$ (du'u) is an easy to understand/clear fact/truth to $f_{2}=sj_2$  about subject $sj_{3}$ under conditions $f_{4}$.
column3: Not jvajvo, but there exist essentially no useful jvajvo definitions for this lujvo.

column2: $x1$=$j2$ is meek/[easily controlled by] $x2$=$f2$=$j1$ in activity $x3$=$j3$ under conditions $x4$=$f3$
$x_1$ (event/object) is easily spotted, obvious to observer $x_2$ with senses $x_3$, under conditions $x_4$.
column3: A safer, healthier and lujvo-er alternative to {li'armi}.

column2: $s_1$ is easily understood/interpreted as the meaning of $s_2$ by (agent) $s_3$=$f_2$ under conditions $f_3$
column3: From {frili}+{smuni}.  The $x_1$ of {frili} is subsumed into the overall sense of the word.  See also: {filseljmi}, {klina}.

column2: $x1$ is a maid working for $x2$
$x_{1}$ takes a fika [social institution]/coffee break together with $x_{2}$ consuming food/beverage $x_{3}$.
column3: From the swedish word "fika". Both "fika" and "fi'ikca" are also derived from the word for coffee in respectively language (kaffi respectively {ckafi}). fi'ikca describes the event where you socialize with others, perhaps over a cup of coffee.  In a swedish context x2 might often be friends or fellow workers, and x3 usually is coffee/squash/(tea) together with a cinnamon roll, cookie, cake, a sandwich etc. But fi'ikca could also be used in a more universal, cultural neutral sense. See also coffeehouse/coffee bar (={kafybarja}), making coffee (={kafpra}).

column2: $x_1$ feels welcome in $x_2$ by $x_3$.
$x_1$ is a fictional work of fantasy about plot/theme/subject $x_2$ by author $x_3$.
$x_1$ is a fern of family/genus/species $x_2$.
$x_1$ is the finale/final/last part leading up to completion of $x_2$
binary mekso operator: divided by (fraction): a/(b...)
column3: This is exactly the same as {fe'i} {vei} except that it is strictly binary (not n-ary). It must be explicitly terminated by {ve'o} or the end of the number construct. This is useful for Lojban and English because people seem to tend to give high priority to "/" in mathematical expressions, despite the notation.

column2: location event contour tense: completive in space; at the far end of ...
tense: right here; refers to current spatial reference absolutely
column3: *Note: Not currently accepted by grammar parsers.* It may be desirable to separate the spatial and time senses of the word {nau}; this is one proposed solution. Alternative: {bu'u} {nau'u}. See {zva'ati}, {ca'abna}

column2: location tense interval modifier: never in space; objectively quantified tense.
location event contour tense: anticipative in space; up to the edge of ...
$x_1$ is a part of Lojban text representing rule 'space-int-props' according to the first edition of the book 'The Complete Lojban Language'.
column3: Inner structure of the rule: (FEhE interval-property)+. For the description of the syntax see {jarnezi}.

column2: location tense interval modifier: always in space; objectively quantified tense.
location event contour tense: superfective in space; continuing too far beyond ...
$x_{1}$ is $10^{-15}$ of $x_{2}$ in dimension/aspect $x_{3}$ (default is units).
$x_{1}$ (agent) divides/partitions/separates $x_{2}$ into sections/parts/ind. $x_{3}$ by method/partition $x_{4}$.
$x_{1}$ is angry/mad at $x_{2}$ for $x_{3}$ (action/state/property).
$x_{1}$ (action/event) is crazy/insane/mad/frantic/in a frenzy (one sense) by standard $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is a crack/fissure/pass/cleft/ravine/chasm/[defect/flaw] [shape/form] in $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is a/the lung [body-part] of $x_{2}$; [metaphor: breathing/respiratory apparatus/bellows].
$x_{1}$ is fertile/conducive for supporting the growth/development of $x_{2}$; $x_{1}$ is fruitful/prolific.
column3: Also fecund (note that the Lojban covers both potential and actual/realized fertility).  See also {vanbi}, {sidju}, {rorci}, {farvi}, {banro}, {cange}.

column2: n-ary mathematical operator: divided by; division operator; [(((a / b) / c) / ...)].
vocative: over and out (end discussion).
$x_1$ is ugly to $x_2$ in aspect $x_3$
$b_1$=$f_1$ roars/snarls/growls angrily utterance $b_2$ at $f_2$ because of $f_3$ (action/state/property).
$x_1$=$b_1$=$f_1$ is sulky/sullen/[in a bad mood] about/[because of] $x_2$=$b_2$=$f_3$ (action/state/property)
$m_1$=$f_1$ is irritated/[mildly angry] at $f_2$ for $f_3$ (action/state/property)
$m_1$=$f_1$=$b_1$ grumbles with sound $b_2$ at $f_2$ because of $f_3$ (action/state/property).
column3: jvajvo definition; Gismu deep structure is "milxe le ka fengu kei gi'e bacru"

column2: $r_1$ (event) angers $f_1$.
$x_1$ makes $x_2$ angry / mad at $x_3$ for $x_4$ (action / state / property); $x_1$ angers / provokes / stirs up $x_2$.
column3: Unlike the usual sense of "to anger", the person causing x2 to be angry (i.e., x1) isn't necessarily the target of the resulting anger (x3).

column2: $x_1$ (person) is crazy/mad/frantic by standard $x_2$.
column3: Cf. {fenki}, which is a crazy event or action.

column2: $x_1$ is November/eleventh month of year $x_2$ in calendar $x_3$.
column3: Note: Based on experimental rafsi for {fei} (fel). Use with caution. Alternative: {pavypavma'i}

column2: $x_1$ is a hand-operated sewing machine of type $x_2$
$x_1$=$c_1$=$f_1$ is a suture made of material $x_2$=$c_2$ for sewing materials/injuries/wounds $x_3$=$f_2$
$m_1$ is a sewing pattern of forms $m_2$ according to structure $m_3$.
$x_1$ is a sewing needle (tool) of type $x_2$
$z_1$ sits in tailor style position/agura/sukhasana on surface $z_2$.
column3: Sits with the lower legs folded towards the body, crossing each other at the ankle or calf, with both ankles on the floor, sometimes with the feet tucked under the knees or thighs. The position is known in several European languages as tailor style.

column2: $fi_1$ is a lungfish/salamanderfish (subclass Dipnoi) of species $fi_2$.
$x_1$=$k_1$ is a lung cancer [malignant disease] in $x_2$=$k_2$=$f_2$
column6: carcinoma of the lung;lung cancer;pulmonary carcinoma

column2: $s_1$ is a cent coin issued by $s_2$ in monetary system $f_3$.
$x_1$ is a sewer carrying waste through $x_2$ that stretches from $x_3$ to $x_4$ and goes through points $x_5$ (set)
$x_1$=$f_2$=$c_1$ abandons / forsakes / leaves behind $x_2$=$f_1$=$c_2$
$x_1$ does not exist/is not real/is not actual/is not reality/is fake for $x_2$ under metaphysics $x_3$; $x_1$ is a fakester/huxter (no intention of tricking, because it does not exist).
column3: This word is equivalent to {tolza'i}. However, there is no hint of it being negative or negated; in fact, it is a positive and affirmative predicate (think of nonexistemce as being the positive form of the binary options between existence and nonexistence). This is important in some counters to Godel's ontological argument, which assumes that existence is the positive condition - perhaps if we had a word-thought construct which assumed nonexistence to be the positive version (so, only this word exists and {zasti} does not), then the argument would work out in exactly the opposite way. This pair (existence/nonexistence) was chosen because there is nothing more fundemental and important to a thing than whether or not it exists. Given these considerations, I should instead say that {zasti} is {to'e} {feiksti}, rather than going with my original presentation.

column2: $x_1$ (event) is a single, non-instantaneous act.
$x_1$ (event) consists of point events repeating in short bursts with pauses in-between (like a woodpecker hammering)
$x_1$ (event) is a random pattern of punctual occurrences (like a sentence being typed out on a keyboard).
column3: Ithkuil's Fragmentative phase. Visually: ·· (space) ···· ·· (space) · (space) ···· et cetera.

column2: $x_1$ (event) is an event slowly repeating as non-instantaneous events with contextually relevant pauses in-between (like a foghorn, or an owl hooting).
$x_1$ (event) happens as a random mixed pattern of point and non-point events (like a sputtering fuse, a chirping bird, a Morse code message).
column3: Ithkuil's Fluctuative phase. Visually: —··–　-·—·· ·– · et cetera.

column2: $x_1$ (event) is an event repeating as a series of point events with contextually relevant pauses in between (like the dripping of a faucet).
$x_1$ (event) is an instantaneous point event.
$x_1$ (event) is an event repeating itself in a rapid staccato manner (like a machine gun burst).
$x_1$ (event) is an event repeating itself as a series of non-point events (like a car horn steadily being honked).
$x_1$ FFFFFFFUUUUUUUUUUUU at $x_2$; $x_1$ expresses extreme rage at  $x_2$ by beginning to say 'fuck'.
$x_1$ is a fennel (Foeniculum vulgare, of the parsley family) of variety $x_2$
column3: Fennel has a sweet, anise-like flavor

column2: $x_1$ is a fenghuang of species $x_2$
$x_1$ is February in year $x_2$ on calendar $x_3$
Ferengi, big-eared short humanoid, in the Star Trek science fiction franchise
$x_1$ is Virgo [constellation/astrological sign].
column3: From {ferti}. The Greeks and Romans associated Virgo with their goddess of wheat, Demeter-Ceres who is the mother of Proserpina-Persephone. For this reason the constellation became associated with fertility (in both Babylonia, Greece and Rome). Alternatively, she was sometimes identified as the virgin goddess Iustitia or Astraea, holding the scales of justice in her hand as the constellation Libra. Since ferti in lojban covers both potential and actual/realized fertility, the original meaning of the constellation have been chosen, but you could probably still interpret the name in both senses (as a deity of fecundity or as a fertile virgin).

column2: letteral for e.
column3: Synonymous with the original CLL definition of .{ebu}.

column2: mekso variable-arity (at most ternary) operator: number of prime divisors of number $X_1$, counting with or without multiplicity according to the value $X_2$ ($1$ xor $0$ respectively; see note for equality to $-1$ and for default value), in structure $X_3$.
column3: $X_1$ may be a number in a generalized sense: anything living in a ring with primes; most commonly, it will be a positive integer. Units are not considered to be prime factors for the purposes of this counting. $x_2$ toggles the type of counting and must be exactly one element of Set$(-1, 0, 1)$. If $x_2 = -1$ and $X_3$ is the typical ring of integers (with the ordering here being the traditional ordering of the integers), then the output is $k =$ sup$($Set$(i: i$ is a positive integer, and $v_{p_i}(X_1) > 0))$, where: $p_i$ is the $i$th prime (such that $p_1 = 2$), and $v_p$ is the $p$-adic valuation (see: "{pau'au}") of the input; in other words, this mode yields the index $i$ of the greatest prime $p_i$ which has a nonzero power $r_i$ such that $p_i^{r_i}$ divides $X_1$; if $X_1$ is a unit and $x_2 = -1$, then this word outputs $0$; if $X_1 = 0$ and $X_2 = -1$, then this word outputs positive infinity; this mode counts early primes which have power $0$ in the prime factorization of $X_1$ but does not count the infinitely many later ones which occur after the last nonzero prime power in that factorization (when $X_1$ is not $0$ and is not a unit). If $X_2 = 0$, then the prime factors with nonzero power are counted without multiplicity (they are counted only uniquely and according to their distinctness, ignoring their exponents unless such is $0$ (in which case, it is not counted)); in other words, under this condition, this word would function as the number-theoretic prime little-omega function LittleOmega$(x_1) =$ Sum$_{p|X_1} (1)$, where: the summation is taken over all $p$, such that all of the bound $p$ must be prime, and "$|$" denotes divisibility of the term on the right (second term) by the term on the left (first term). If $X_2 = 1$, then multiple factors of the same prime are counted (specifically: the (maximal) exponents of the prime factors in the prime factorization of $X_1$ are added together); this is the number-theoretic prime big-omega function BigOmega$(x_1) =$ Sum$_{p^r||X_1} (1)$, where: the notation is as for $x_2 = -1$ or $0$ supra as need be, the summation is taken over such $p$, and "$||$" denotes the fact that the said corresponding $r = v_p(X_1)$ (id est: $p^r$ is the maximal power of $p$ which divides $X_1$). No other option for the value of $X_2$ is currently defined. $X_2$ might have contextual/cultural/conventional defaults, but the contextless default value is $X_2 = 1$. $X_3$ specifies the (algebraic) structure in which primehood/factoring is being considered/performed (equipped also with an ordering of the primes); it need not be specified if the context is clear; if such is sensible for the other inputs, the contextless default for $X_3$ is the typical ring of integers (with the ordering being the traditional ordering of the integers and the 1st prime being $p_1 = 2$). See also: "{pau'au}"; https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Prime_omega_function .
column6: prime-factor-counting function;prime factors count;prime omega function;prime omega function

column2: Prefix division by following unit selbri
column3: Cf. {pi'ai}, {te'ai}, {fi'u}. Essentially attaches "te'ai ni'u pa" to all subsequent unit-selbri in the tanru. E.g. "pi'ai ki'otre fei'u cacra" = "pi'ai ki'otre cacra te'ai ni'u pa" = "kilometers per hour"; "pi'ai mitre fei'u snidu snidu" = meters per second per second. May even be used without pi'ai: "fei'u snidu" = reciprocal of the second / hertz

column2: Vocative: Fin, the end, you may applaud now, conclusion; story ending or punchline marker
column3: Indicates the end of a story or performance or the punchline of a joke. The utterer may not be done speaking, but the story that they are telling is over. It allows the audience to get a sense of certain conclusion and to thus appreciate the story without expecting more.

column2: marks end of prenex in stack-based dialect
column3: switches to a stack-based dialect of Lojban. Separates stack elements from following stack operators. Sequential stack operators are separated either via .{ije} or by chaining them into tanru (operators to be applied from each tanru left to right). Popping top stack element into output is done using {fasnu} or {fatci}. '.i lezmiku lenatmi leprenu lekraice fi'ai du .ije srana .ije gandygau' means 'The loyal man of the nation deactivates the robot'. 'xy.boi y.buboi zy.boi fi'ai setmice cmima .i lenatmi leprenu lekraice fi'ai du .ije srana .ije gandygau' means 'The loyal man of the nation deactivates X,Y, and Z'.

column2: mekso operator: continued fraction, Kettenbruch notation; for ordered input $(X_1, X_2, X_3, X_4)$, where: $X_1$ is an ordered pair of functions and $X_2$ is a free or dummy variable/input/index which ranges through set $X_3$ in order(ing) $X_4$, the result is $K_{(X_2, (X_3, X_4))} (X_1(X_2))$ for Kettenbruch notation $K$.
column3: $X_1$ will be an ordered pair of functions defined on $X_3$ and with input $X_2$. Let $X_1 = (a, b)$ where '$a$' and $b$ are each functions (defined on X_3), $X_3$ be the set of all nonnegative integers which are strictly less than some positive integer or positive infinity (denoted by "n+1") as determined by the context/problem, and $X_4$ be the standard ordering on $X_3$; then the output will be: a(0) + b(0)/(a(1) + b(1)/(a(2) + b(2)/(.../(a(n-1) + b(n-1)/(a(n) + b(n)))))), where division has higher operator priority than addition and where, if n is positive infinity, then the expression never terminates and convergence of subfractions is necessary for well-definition; the inputs of '$a$' and $b$ technically can be ordered tuples so long as they symbolically include $X_2$ and all other parameters are specified.  In general, $a(min(X_3))$, for $min$ being defined according to the ordering $X_4$, will be the formally 'integer'-part of the expression (even if it evaluates to a fraction) - in other words, it is the number which is entirely outside of the nested fractions. This operator is intended to be maximally general; some definition for $X_3$ being the empty set can be devised, or '$a$' or $b$ could be function-valued or otherwise exotic-valued functions (so long as their outputs have sum, division, and closure properties), etc. See also: "{se'au}". If diphthong "eu" is ever accepted into Lojban, this definition would preferably be moved to "{fi'eu}" (because the "eu" would also be etymologically tied to "Kettenbruch", and the "au" diphthong is more basic and should be reserved for higher-priority words).

column2: {ifle} modal, 1st place: if [sumti] (du'u or nu) is true...
$x_1$ is the minor key of tonic $x_2$ of/with type/notes $x_3$.
$x_1$ is the major key of tonic $x_2$ of/with type/notes $x_3$.
$x_1$ is June in year $x_2$ on calendar $x_3$
$x_1$ is (a/some) krill [member of malacostracan crustacean order: Euphausiacea] of subtaxon/type/genus/species/variety/breed $x_2$
$x_1$ is a fiacre, a small hackney carriage
$x_1$ is a fiesta
vocative: \n{fi'i } - hospitality\n{fi'i nai} - inhospitality.
$x_{1}$ reflects Palestinian culture/nationality in aspect $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is a fish of species $x_{2}$ [metaphorical extension to sharks, non-fish aquatic vertebrates].
$x_{1}$ invents/creates/composes/authors $x_{2}$ for function/purpose $x_{3}$ from existing elements/ideas $x_{4}$.
column3: $x_1$ is creative/inventive.  See also cmavo list {fi'e}, {ciska}, {pemci}, {zbasu}, {larcu}, specific works of authorship, {prosa}, {skina}.

column2: $x_{1}$ is a law specifying $x_{2}$ (state/event) for community $x_{3}$ under conditions $x_{4}$ by lawgiver(s) $x_{5}$.
column3: $x_1$ is a legality; $x_2$ is legal/licit/legalized/a legality (= {selfla} for reordered places).  See also {javni}, {ritli}, {zekri}, {pulji}, {tinbe}.

column2: $x_{1}$ is a flute/pipe/fife/recorder [flute-like/air-reed musical instrument].
$x_{1}$ is born to $x_{2}$ at time $x_{3}$ [birthday] and place $x_{4}$ [birthplace]; $x_{1}$ is native to (fo) $x_{4}$.
column3: $x_2$ bears/gives birth to $x_1$; also $x_3$: natal day.  See also {fange}, {gutra}, {rorci}, {mamta}, {salci}, {citsi}.

column2: $x_{1}$ (agent) borrows/temporarily takes/assumes $x_{2}$ (object) from source $x_{3}$ for interval $x_{4}$.
column3: Credit (= {jernu'e}); borrow/assume a property or quality as a chameleon does (= {zaskai}, {zasysmitra}, {zasysmitai}).  See also {dejni}, {janta}, {zivle}.

column2: $x_{1}$ is between/among set of points/bounds/limits $x_{2}$ (set)/amidst mass $x_{2}$ in property $x_{3}$ (ka).
column3: $x_2$ (a complete set, generally ordered) defines the bounds/limits/range for $x_1$.  See also se {vasru}, {nenri}, {zvati}, {cpana}, {snuji}, {senta}, {bitmu}, {jimte}, {kuspe}, {jibni}, {lamji}, {sruri}, {vanbi}, {midju}, {cmima}, {setca}.

column2: $x_{1}$ is firm/hard/resistant/unyielding to force $x_{2}$ under conditions $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ (person) decides/makes decision $x_{2}$ (du'u) about matter $x_{3}$ (event/state).
$x_{1}$ (experiencer) decreases/contracts/is reduced/diminished in property/quantity $x_{2}$ by amount $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ [amount] is the price of $x_{2}$ to purchaser/consumer $x_{3}$ set by vendor $x_{4}$.
column3: $x_2$ may be a specific object, a commodity (mass), an event, or a property; pedantically, for objects/commodities, this is sumti-raising from ownership of the object/commodity (= {posydi'a}, {posyseldi'a} for unambiguous semantics); price is something decided/set by the seller, and is closely akin to offer ({friti}), which is what a buyer may decide; (note that price is not he same as cost/expense, which is the actual amount exchanged in a transaction; the latter is {vecnu} or {canja}; neither is the same as "value" or {vamji}; in colloquial English, these are sometimes interchanged, at least partially because of the rarity of barter and bargaining in the marketplace).  See also {canja}, {friti}, {janta}, {jdini}, {kargu}, {pleji}, {dapma}, {vamji} for 'value', ve {vecnu} for 'cost', {canja}, {fepni}, {jerna}, {jinga}, {prali}, {rupnu}, {sfasa}, {vamji}.

column2: $x_{1}$ is money/currency issued by $x_{2}$; (adjective:) $x_{1}$ is financial/monetary/pecuniary/fiscal.
column3: 'currency' sometimes is restricted to paper money (= {pledi'i}).  See also {fepni}, {jdima}, {rupnu}, {sicni}, {canja}.

column2: $x_{1}$ is a quantity of jelly/semisolid [texture] of material/composition including $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is a polity/state governing territory/domain $x_{2}$; [government/territory relationship].
$x_{1}$ (event/experience) warns/cautions $x_{2}$ (person) of/about danger $x_{3}$ (event/state/property).
column3: Agentive warning (= {jdegau}, {jdezu'e}); an attempt to warn which may not succeed (= {jdetoi}, {jdegautoi}, {jdezuktoi}).  See also {ckape}, {nupre}, {snura}, {tcica}, {xlura}.

column2: $x_{1}$ is a shelf/counter/bar in/on/attached to supporting object $x_{2}$, for purpose $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ is able to do/be/capable of doing/being $x_{2}$ (event/state) under conditions $x_{3}$ (event/state).
column3: Also: has talent; know how to; know how to use (= {plika'e}).  (cf. {stati}, {certu}, {gasnu} (in the time-free potential sense), {cmavo} list {ka'e}, cmavo list {nu'o}, cmavo list {pu'i}, {djuno}, {zifre})

column2: $x_{1}$ (agent) digs $x_{2}$ [material] up/out of $x_{3}$ [source/hole] with limbs/tool(s) $x_{4}$.
column3: Also $x_1$ cuts into $x_3$ (with material removal).  See also {katna}, {plixa}, {sraku}, {canpa}, {sraku}.

column2: $x_{1}$ is a/the feces/excrement/dung/shit of $x_{2}$ (animal/person); (adjective:) $x_{1}$ is fecal (matter).
$x_{1}$ (portal/passage/entrance-way) is open/ajar/not shut permitting passage/access to $x_{2}$ by $x_{3}$.
column3: As a doorway. $x_{3}$ is given access to $x_{2}$ through portal $x_{1}$. See also {ganlo}, {pagre}, {canko}, {vorme}.

column2: $x_{1}$ is chaotic/disordered in property/aspect $x_{2}$ (ka).
$x_{1}$ hunts/stalks prey/quarry/game $x_{2}$ for purpose $x_{3}$.
column3: Also verb: to fish (= {fipkalte}).  See also {jersi}, {kavbu}, {sisku}, {rivbi}.

column2: $x_{1}$ is a column/pillar of material $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ (mass) is a committee with task/purpose $x_{2}$ of body $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ (property - ka) is common/general/universal among members of set $x_{2}$ (complete set).
column3: Only fully universal sense applies; $x_1$ must be found in all members of $x_2$.  For the non-universal sense see {fadni} and {zilfadni}.  See also {cafne}, {rirci}, {fadni}, {cnano}, {tcaci}, {lakne}, {cmima}, {simxu}.

column2: $x_{1}$ is a goat/angora/[billy-goat/kid] of species/breed $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ (agent) counts the number in set $x_{2}$ to be $x_{3}$ [number/count] counting [off] by units $x_{4}$.
$x_{1}$ is dim/dull/pale/non-intense in property $x_{2}$ (ka) as received/measured by observer $x_{3}$.
column3: In colors, indicates unsaturated, pastel, pale (though blabi can also indicate a kind of paleness).  See also {blabi}, {carmi}, {klina}, {linto}, {manku}, {murse}, {ruble}, {skari}, {milxe}, {blanu}, {bunre}, {cicna}, {crino}, {grusi}, {narju}, {nukni}, {pelxu}, {xekri}, {xunre}, {zirpu}.

column2: $x_{1}$ calculates/reckons/computes $x_{2}$ [value (ni)/state] from data $x_{3}$ by process $x_{4}$.
$x_{1}$ is a/the eye [body-part] of $x_{2}$; [metaphor: sensory apparatus]; (adjective:) $x_{1}$ is ocular.
$x_{1}$ is healthy/fit/well/in good health by standard $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is with/accompanies/is a companion of $x_{2}$, in state/condition/enterprise $x_{3}$ (event/state).
column3: $x_1$ is together with/along with $x_2$. See also {kagni}, {jorne}, {gunma}, {girzu}, {lasna}.

column2: $x_{1}$ is a quantum/ray/elementary particle/smallest measurable increment of property/activity $x_{2}$.
column3: Quantum ray (= {bonka'u}).  (cf. {selci} for masses and most objects; {ratni}, {gradu}, {gusni}, {nejni}, {linji})

column2: $x_{1}$ is a conjunction, stating that $x_{2}$ (du'u) and $x_{3}$ (du'u) are both true.
$x_{1}$ [observer] compares $x_{2}$ with $x_{3}$ in property $x_{4}$ (ka), determining comparison $x_{5}$ (state).
$x_{1}$ is a car/automobile/truck/van [a wheeled motor vehicle] for carrying $x_{2}$, propelled by $x_{3}$
$x_{1}$ is a card [small nearly-2-dimensional shape/form] of material $x_{2}$, shape $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ (object/commodity/property/event) is costly/expensive/dear to $x_{2}$ by standard $x_{3}$.
column3: $x_1$ may be a specific object, a commodity (mass), an event, or a property; pedantically, for objects/commodities, this is sumti-raising from ownership of the object/commodity (= {poskargu} for unambiguous semantics).  See also {vamji}, {dirba}, {vajni}, {jdima}, {pleji}, {canja}, {jerna}, {jinga}, {jemna}, {sfasa}, {vecnu}.

column2: $x_{1}$ is a collar/ring/belt/band around/surrounding $x_{2}$ made of material $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ is a journal/periodical/magazine/[newspaper] with content $x_{2}$ published by $x_{3}$ for audience $x_{4}$.
column3: $x_2$ may be a subject, but not all journals have a single subject; all have some sort of principle defining what is included, so this need not be a list.  See also {papri}, {pelji}, {tcidu}.

column2: $x_{1}$ (tool/blade/force) cuts [through]/splits/divides $x_{2}$ (object) into pieces $x_{3}$.
column3: For $x_1$ force, it is a force acting as a blade, not acting upon a blade; agentive cutting (= {ka'argau}, {ka'arzu'e}).  (cf. {kakpa}, {sraku} for cutting into without division; {plixa}, {dakfu}, {jinci}, {porpi}, {spofu}, {tunta}, {xrani}, {fatri}, {fendi}, {balre}, {dilcu})

column2: $x_{1}$ captures/catches/apprehends/seizes/nabs $x_{2}$ with trap/restraint $x_{3}$.
column3: Catch something thrown (= {rerkavbu}).  See also {jersi}, {kalte}, {pinfu}, {sisku}, se {rinju}.

column2: $x_{1}$ (person) pities/feels sorry for $x_{2}$ (person) about $x_{3}$ (abstraction).
$x_{1}$ [agent] plays with plaything/toy $x_{2}$.
column3: Play game (= {ci'erkei}), play competitively (= {jvikei}).  See also {jivna}, {jinga}, {zdile}.

column2: $x_{1}$ is $x_{2}$ degree(s) Kelvin [metric unit] in temperature (default is 1) by standard $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ is a cancer [malignant disease] in $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is outer space near/associated with celestial body/region $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is a/the hair/fur [body-part] of $x_{2}$ at body location $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ is a/the ear [body-part] of $x_{2}$; [metaphor: sensory apparatus, information gathering].
$x_{1}$ reflects South American culture/nationality/geography in aspect $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is a cavity/hole/hollow/cavern in $x_{2}$; $x_{1}$ is concave within $x_{2}$; $x_{2}$ is hollow at locus $x_{1}$.
column3: Also pit, depression, concavity; hollow (= {selke'a}).  See also {fenra}, {kunti}, {canlu}, {canko}, {galxe}, {tubnu}.

column2: $x_{1}$ cushions $x_{2}$ with material $x_{3}$; $x_{1}$ is a cushion/pillow/pad [for $x_{2}$] of padding material $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ (object/medium) is clear/transparent/without obstacle to in-the-clear $x_{2}$ [transmission].
column3: Also lucid; $x_2$ remains apparent/lucid/clear (figurative use for 'understandable' is discouraged, better expressed as = {filseljmi} or {filsmu}).  (cf. {kandi}, {zunti} - {nalzu'i} is better for 'unhindered')

column2: $x_{1}$ is a quantity of/contains/is made of halogen of type $x_{2}$ [chlorine, fluorine, iodine, etc.].
column3: Also bromine; default chlorine. See also {xukmi}.

column2: $x_{1}$ is a quantity of/contains/is made of clay [moist, clammy dirt] of composition including $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is a screw [fastener] for purpose $x_{2}$, threads [pitch, material] $x_{3}$, frame [size, material] $x_{4}$.
$x_{1}$ (obj.) is loose/bloused/not tight on $x_{2}$ (obj.) at locus $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ is a quantity of cabbage/lettuce/leafy vegetable of species/strain $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is a corner/point/at-least-3-dimensional [solid] angle [shape/form] in/on $x_{2}$, of material $x_{3}$.
column3: Also apex; a corner exists on three dimensions but need not be limited to points; it suggests a discontinuity in slope in some direction; i.e. in some planar cross-section.  See also {jipno}, {konju}, {bliku}, {fanmo}, {jganu}, {krasi}.

column2: $x_{1}$ is a quantity of/contains/is made of coal/peat/anthracite/bitumen from source $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is a comb [many-needled shape] of material $x_{2}$ with tines/needles $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ is a cone [shape/form] of material $x_{2}$ with vertex $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ is an edge/margin/border/curb/boundary of $x_{2}$ next-to/bordering-on $x_{3}$.
(adjective:) $x_{1}$ is bent/crooked/not straight or direct/[twisted]/folded.
$x_{1}$ is a quantity of/contains/is made of cork/bark from tree/species $x_{2}$; [material].
$x_{1}$ is a coat/jacket/sweater/cloak/[cape/shawl/pullover] [extra outer garment] of material $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is $x_{2}$ local area unit(s) [non-metric] (default 1) by standard $x_{3}$, $x_{4}$ subunits.
column3: (additional subunit places may be added as $x_5$, $x_6$, ...); See also {rupnu}, {fepni}, {dekpu}, {gutci}, {minli}, {merli}, {bunda}.

column2: $x_{1}$ (site/event) is a source/start/beginning/origin of $x_{2}$ (object/event/process).
column3: Also root (figurative sense); (adjective:) $x_1$ is initial.  See also {fanmo}, cmavo list {ra'i}, {sabji}, {cfari}, {jipno}, {traji}, {kojna}, {genja}, {jicmu}, {sitna}, {jinto}.

column2: $x_{1}$ represents/is an agent/proxy/stands-in for [absent] $x_{2}$ in matter(s)/function(s) $x_{3}$.
column3: Also: on behalf of.  See also cmavo list {ka'i}, {jansu}, {catni}, {vipsi}, {pulji}.

column2: $x_{1}$ (event) is the $x_{3}$'rd recurrence/repetition of $x_{2}$ (abstract); $x_{2}$ happens again in [form] $x_{1}$.
column3: Also case, another, instance, different, other, time, occasion.  See also {fukpi}, {rapli}, {cafne}, {fasnu}, {xruti}.

column2: $x_{1}$ believes [regardless of evidence/proof] belief/creed $x_{2}$ (du'u) is true/assumed about subject $x_{3}$.
column3: without evidence refers to objective external evidence; also gives credence, has conviction.  See also {jinvi}, {djuno}, {censa}, {cevni}, {lijda}, {makfa}, {malsi}, {senpi}, {birti}.

column2: $x_{1}$ is a quantity of/contains/is made of crystal of composition $x_{2}$ in form/arrangement $x_{3}$.
column3: $x_2$: composition including $x_2$, which need not be complete specification.  See also {jemna}, {bisli}.

column2: $x_{1}$ (event/state) is a reason/justification/explanation for/causing/permitting $x_{2}$ (event/state).
column3: See also {ciksi}, {rinka}, {nibli}, {mukti}, se {jalge}, te {zukte}, cmavo list {ki'u}, {bapli}.

column2: $x_{1}$ cries out/yells/howls sound $x_{2}$; $x_{1}$ is a crier.
$x_{1}$ intersects/crosses/traverses $x_{2}$ at locus $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ is made of/contains/is a quantity of cream/emulsion/puree [consistency] of composition $x_{2}$.
column3: [$x_2$: composition including $x_2$, which need not be complete specification]]; See also {ladru}, {matne}.

column2: $x_{1}$ is a curve/turn/bend in $x_{2}$, at locus $x_{3}$, and defined by set of points/properties $x_{4}$.
column3: (adjective:) $x_1$ is curved; ($x_4$ as a set of points is sufficiently specified to identify the relevant properties of the bend).  See also {korcu}, {bargu}, {genxu}, {linji}, {sirji}.

column2: $x_{1}$ is a cube/regular polyhedron/polygon of dimensions $x_{2}$ (def. 3), surfaces/sides $x_{3}$ (def. 6).
column3: (cf. {kurfa} - needed for 'cube', {bliku} for a physical object; {tanbo}, {tapla}, {tarmi})

column2: $x_{1}$ is curious/wonders about/is interested in/[inquisitive about] $x_{2}$ (object/abstract).
$x_{1}$ feels comfort/is comfortable with conditions/environmental property(ies) $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is delicious/tasty/delightful to observer/sense $x_{2}$ [person, or sensory activity].
$x_{1}$ [mass of ideas, customs, skills, arts] is culture of nation/ethos $x_{2}$ (mass); $x_{1}$ is ethnic.
column3: (note that $x_2$ is NOT individual; culture is what is shared among people and is not an individual trait).  See also cmavo list {ka'u}, cmavo list {ku'u}, {natmi}, {cecmu}.

column2: $x_{1}$ is a room of/in structure $x_{2}$ surrounded by partitions/walls/ceiling/floor $x_{3}$ (mass/jo'u).
$x_{1}$ is a camel/llama/alpaca/vicuna/dromedary of species/breed $x_{2}$.
column3: Llama (= {tcokumte}), Bactrian camel (= {zdokumte}); Arabian camel/dromedary (= {rabykumte}).  See also {sunla}, {kanla}, {xirma}, {xasli}.

column2: $x_{1}$ is/contains/is made from a mineral/ore of type/metal $x_{2}$ mined from location/lode/mine $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ [container] is empty/vacant of $x_{2}$ [material]; $x_{1}$ is hollow.
column3: Also vacuum (= kunti be roda/so'ada).  See also {culno}, {tisna}, {claxu}, {canlu}, {kevna}, {setca}.

column2: $x_{1}$ is a right-angled shape/form defined by set of vertices $x_{2}$, dimensions $x_{3}$ (default 2).
column3: Also rectangle, square, rectilinear; square (= {kubykurfa}, {pitkubykurfa}), cube (= {kurkubli}), rectangle (= {clakurfa}), rhombus/diamond (= {sa'orkurfa}, {sa'orpitkubli}).  See also {bliku}, {kubli}, {tapla}, {salpo}, {tarmi}.

column2: $x_{1}$ takes-care-of/looks after/attends to/provides for/is caretaker for $x_{2}$ (object/event/person).
column3: Also tends, cares for, keeps; $x_1$ is a keeper/custodian of $x_2$.  See also {jundi}, {cinri}, {prami}, {raktu}, {zgana}.

column2: $x_{1}$ is bitter/acrid/sharply disagreeable to observer/sense $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ ranges/extends/spans/persists/reaches across/over interval/gap/area/scope/extent/range $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ (person) is cruel/mean/unkind to victim $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is a wolf/lupine of species/breed $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is a flag/banner/standard of/symbolizing $x_{2}$ with pattern(s) $x_{3}$ on material $x_{4}$.
$x_{1}$ is a basket with contents $x_{2}$, woven from material $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ analyzes/examines-in-detail $x_{2}$ by method/technique/system $x_{3}$ [process/activity].
$x_{1}$ is a sheep/[lamb/ewe/ram] of species/breed $x_{2}$ of flock $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ is a can/tightly sealed/pre-sealed container for perishable contents $x_{2}$, made of $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ is in balance/equilibrium under forces $x_{2}$ (mass).
$x_{1}$ (mass) is a family with members including $x_{2}$ bonded/tied/joined according to standard $x_{3}$.
column3: Also clan, tribe; $x_2$ is in $x_1$, a member of $x_1$ ({selylanzu} for reordered places); relative (= {lazmi'u} - xy mintu y'y leka cmima da poi lanzu).  See also {natmi}, {cmima}, {girzu}, {jutsi}, {klesi}.

column2: $x_{1}$ (process) is an art [creative application] of craft/skill $x_{2}$ (idea/activity).
$x_{1}$ (agent) fastens/connects/attaches/binds/lashes $x_{2}$ to $x_{3}$ with fastener $x_{4}$.
column3: No implication that result is considered a single object; although $x_2$ and $x_3$ may be reversible, $x_3$ may be used for the substrate, the fixed/larger object to which $x_2$ becomes attached. See also {jorne}, {fenso}, {jgena}, {batke}, {dinko}, {kansa}.

column2: $x_{1}$ is a quantity of/contains/is made of brass [copper/zinc alloy] of composition including $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ reflects Latin/Roman/Romance culture/empire/language in aspect $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is mature/ripe/fully-grown/adult in development-quality $x_{2}$ (ka).
$x_{1}$ is magic/supernatural/sorcery/witchcraft/wizardry to $x_{2}$, performed by person/force/deity $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ is magnetic [adjective] producing magnetic field $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is a temple/church/sanctuary/synagogue/shrine of religion $x_{2}$ at location/serving area $x_{3}$.
column3: $x_2$ may be event of form (... worships/pays/respect to ...), hence (metaphorically extending to) monument (= {mojmalsi}, {si'armalsi}).  See also {cevni}, {krici}, {lijda}, {ritli}.

column2: $x_{1}$ is a mother of $x_{2}$; $x_{1}$ bears/mothers/acts maternally toward $x_{2}$; [not necessarily biological].
$x_{1}$ feels wonder/awe/marvels about $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ (object/event) is uniform/homogeneous in property $x_{2}$ (ka).
$x_{1}$ is dark/lacking in illumination.
$x_{1}$ is a frame of reference/standard for observing/measuring/determining $x_{2}$, with/by rules $x_{3}$.
column3: ($x_1$ may be object or si'o idea); See also cmavo list {ma'i}, {ckilu}, {merli}, {pajni}, {cimde}, {jdice}, {marde}.

column2: $x_{1}$ satisfies evaluator $x_{2}$ in property (ka)/state $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ is an ant of species/breed $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is a cap/hat/crown/helmet/piece of headgear [head-top garment] of material $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is a quantity of/contains/is made of cotton [type of fabric/material].
$x_{1}$ fits/matches/suits/is compatible/appropriate/corresponds to/with $x_{2}$ in property/aspect $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ is a shelter/haven/refuge/retreat/harbor for/protecting $x_{2}$ from danger/threat $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ is a vehicle/mode of transport carrying $x_{2}$ in/on surface/medium $x_{3}$, propelled by $x_{4}$.
$x_{1}$ are the ethics/morals/moral standards/ethical standards of $x_{2}$ (ind./mass) about situation $x_{3}$.
column3: $x_1$ will (typically) be an abstract, a rule or rules of behavior; also principles; also conscience (= {sezmarde}).  See also {palci}, {vrude}, {lijda}, {manri}, {javni}, {tarti}, {zekri}.

column2: $x_{1}$ is a quantity of/contains/made of mercury/quicksilver; [metaphor: fluid metal; temperature].
$x_{1}$ is material/stuff/matter of type/composition including $x_{2}$ in shape/form $x_{3}$.
column3: Also (adjective:) $x_1$ is physical (one sense)/material.  See also {morna}, {mucti}, {nejni}, {tarmi}, {dacti}.

column2: $x_{1}$ is a quantity of hemp/marijuana/jute of species/strain $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ [force] mashes/crushes/squashes/smashes $x_{2}$ into pulp/mash/crumbs/deformed mass $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ is slow/sluggish at doing/being/bringing about $x_{2}$ (event/state).
$x_{1}$ is $x_{2}$ months in duration (default is 1 month) by month standard $x_{3}$.
column3: This month (= {cabma'i}); next month (= {bavla'ima'i}); last month (= {prula'ima'i}).  See also {detri}, {djedi}, {jeftu}, {nanca}.

column2: $x_{1}$ is a mat/pad/mattress/pallet [flat, soft, dense form] of material $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is a quantity of/contains/is made of linen/flax [type of fabric/material].
$x_{1}$ is a quantity of/contains butter/oleo/margarine/shortening from source $x_{2}$.
column3: (adjective:) $x_1$ is buttery; an edible fat, solid but spreadable at normal temperatures; dairy butter (= {ladmatne}).  See also {grasu}, {kruji}.

column2: $x_{1}$ is a motor/engine, driving/propelling/providing power to $x_{2}$.
digit/number: imaginary i; square root of -1.
column3: Acts as a number punctuation mark (separating the real and the imaginary parts of a complex number); for example "ci ka'o re" means 3 + 2i. See also: {kau'o}, {ka'o'ai}, {ka'o'ei}.

column2: evidential: I know by cultural means (myth or custom).
discursive: marks word serving as focus of indirect question: "I know WHO went to the store".
start grouping of tanru, etc; ... type of ... ; overrides normal tanru left grouping.
pro-sumti: relativized sumti (object of relative clause).
elidable terminator: end of tanru left grouping override (usually elidable).
open interval bracket marker; modifies intervals in non-logical connectives; exclude boundaries.
elidable terminator: end abstraction bridi (often elidable).
vocative: please repeat.
discursive: \n{ke'u} - repeating\n{ke'unai} - continuing.
tense/modal: set/use tense default; establishes new open scope space/time/modal reference base.
attitudinal question: confusion about something said.
vocative: \n{ki'e} - thanks\n{ki'enai} - no thanks to you.
{ckini} modal, 1st place (related to)               relatively; as a relation of ...
pro-sumti: you (imperative); make it true for you, the listener.
pro-sumti: he/she/it/they #1 (specified by goi).
pro-sumti: he/she/it/they #2 (specified by goi).
pro-sumti: he/she/it/they #3 (specified by goi).
{korbi} modal, 1st place (bordered by)              bounded by ...
pro-sumti: he/she/it/they #4 (specified by goi).
pro-sumti: he/she/it/they #5 (specified by goi).
elidable terminator: end description, modal, or negator sumti; often elidable.
non-logical connective: intersection of sets.
elidable terminator: end mathematical (mex) forethought (Polish) expression; often elidable.
discursive: however/but/in contrast.
elidable terminator: end NOI relative clause; always elidable, but preferred in complex clauses.
{kulnu} modal, 1st place                            in culture ...
letteral for k.
name descriptor: the one(s) called ... ; takes name or selbri description.
discursive: \n{la'a} - probability\n{la'anai} - improbability.
delimited non-Lojban name; the resulting quote sumti is treated as a name.
convert letteral string or other mathematical expression (mex) operand to mex operator.
*$moved to {karmo}$*
$x_1$ expects/looks for the occurence of $x_2$ (event), expected likelihood $x_3$ (0-1, default {li} {so'a} i.e. near 1); $x_1$ subjectively evaluates the likelihood of $x_2$ (event) to be $x_3$.
column3: The value of $x_3$ is a subjective estimate of likeliness according to $x_1$, and is the basic determinant of whether kanpe means something like "hope" or "wish" or "expect", although kanpe never carries the connotation of desire; for that connotation see {pacna}. kanpe with $x_3$ not very close to 1 has no simple equivalent in English, but for objects/states with negligible expectation it is something like "wishing"; if the state is plausibly likely, it is something like "hoping". In both cases, though, the English implication of emotional desire is not present. The value will usually be expressed using inexact numbers ("{li} {piso'u}" to "{li} {piro}"); not-necessarily desirous wish, not necessarily desirous hope. See also {ba'a}, {djica}, {pacna}, {lakne}, {cunso}.

column2: $x_1$ is a chili/bell pepper (Capsicum) of species/variety $x_2$
$x_1$ is turned on / activated / operational for function $x_2$
column3: Syn. {akti}. Turned off = {ganda}, to turn on (agentive) = {katcygau}, to turn off (agentive) = {gandygau}. Also see {tolpo'u}.

column2: $x_1$ is a/the penis [body-part] of $x_2$
$x_1$ is "quasi" in property (ka) $x_2$; $x_1$ is "similar but not quite"/analogical to/comparable to having property $x_2$; $x_1$ is a quasi-$x_2$.
column3: Different from {simlu} in that {simlu} assumes that the seemingly present property is actually absent, and different from {simsa} in that {simsa} focuses on the similarity, whereas this word focuses on the difference.

column2: $x_1$ (li) is the cardinality of set $x_2$ (set)
column3: Exactly equivalent to {nilzilcmi} except in morphology. But cardinality is a pretty fundamental thing in mathematics (in some sense, even more fundamental than natural numbers), so it arguably deserves a gismu; this will also shorten many lujvo which should use a word for cardinality. The second terbri should technically be filled by a set, but other structures could probably be acceptable; these might include groups and other algebraic structures, multisets, lists, classes, vel sim. {ci'i} alone (without being followed by another (integer-representing) digit) indicates an infinite cardinality but not which one; beware the assumption of the Axiom of Choice or Generalized Continuum Hypothesis.

column2: $x_1$ reflects Quebec nationality/culture/geography in aspect $x_2$ (ka)
$x_{1}$ is $10^{(-30)}$ of $x_{2}$ in dimension/aspect $x_{3}$ (default is units).
$x_1$ is represents Celtic culture in aspect $x_2$
column3: Not necessarily confined to the British Isles. See also: {skoto}.

column2: $k_1$ is a quantity of cake/torte/tart/pie/flan made of/containing ingredients $k_2$, prepared according to method $k_3$.
$x_1$ (state/event/fact) is fair/just/righteous to $x_2$ according to $x_3$
column3: According to $x_3$, the way $x_2$ is treated in $x_1$ is just (it is "as things should be"). See also {pajni}, {sarxe}, {vrude}, {vudypai}, {nutli}, {pairnu'i}. (Many of those words deal with some judge acting "fairly" or "justly" in some matter, which kerni does not. In fact, a "to'e kerni" (unfair) situation is not necessarily the result of evil, may be considered unfair to all parties, and may be nobody's fault.)

column2: $x_1$ (property of $x_2$) is a stereotype of $x_2$ (object/set), held by $x_3$
column3: Does not necessarily carry a negative connotation. Stereotypes are, basically, the characteristics that come to one's mind when they imagine a particular object, regardless of actual commonality. e.g. Many people stereotypically think of roses as red, even though there are plenty of roses that aren't red. See {sei'i}, {lemkai}, {le'e}

column2: $x_{1}$ is $10^{30}$ of $x_{2}$ in dimension/aspect $x_{3}$ (default is units).
$x_1$ pertains to the internet/cyberspace in aspect $x_2$.
column3: Proposed by xorxes. Short rafsi -kib-. Cf. {mujysamseltcana}.

column2: $x_1$ (set/space) is closed under(/wrt) operator/relation $x_2$; $x_2$ has closure in $x_1$.
column3: Identical to {klojere} but is a gismu (as it might be considered to be a fairly fundamental concept which is productive).

column2: $x_1$ is a coconut of variety/cultivar $x_2$
$x_1$ (set/shape) is convex in sense $x_2$.
column3: A function cannot really be convex (its epigraph can be though). This word is the gismu form of "{konvexi}".

column2: $s_1$ is a crow/raven of species $s_2$.
column3: See {cipnrkorvo} for a non-experimental version of this word.

column2: $x_1$ (abstraction) is a purpose/use of $x_2$ (object or event), attributed by $x_3$
column3: Place structure has been inverted from the original version to match {krinu}. Syn. {erpi}. See {ko'au}, {terpli}, {terzu'e}, {terfi'i}

column2: $x_1$ (NU) is a legal/moral entitlement of $x_2$ (individual/mass) by standard $x_3$. $x_2$ is a legal person.
